meanings.definition: Moving or working slowly and steadily
meanings.sent1: The turtle made a ploddingly progress across the yard.
meanings.sent2: The ploddingly pace of the snail was a familiar sight in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The ploddingly sloth took its time climbing the tree, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The ploddingly tortoise in the race surprised everyone by winning in the end.
meanings.sent5: The ploddingly elephant trudged through the jungle, leaving deep footprints behind.

meanings.definition: In a slow and laborious manner
meanings.sent1: He worked ploddingly through the difficult math problem.
meanings.sent2: The old man walked ploddingly up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The ploddingly student tried to finish the assignment before the bell rang.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass ploddingly as they waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The snail moved ploddingly along the path, leaving a shiny trail behind.
